intro: Lophanthus iranshahrii, commonly known as the Persian lophanthus, is a rare flowering plant native to Iran. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with a prominent keel. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showing a high degree of adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are trifoliate, and it produces small, legume-like pods that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
